author: peter.davies
content: There are tests that cover the behaviour of the chain in the presence of accounts that have no nonce, no balance, no code, but do have non-zero storage keys.

author: peter.davies
content: These edge cases are a nuisance and such accounts cannot be created on chain that follows any version of the Ethereum protocol except at genesis. I propose we declare the behaviour of the chain undefined in their presence.

author: samwilsn
content: Is there any reason why, in EIP-161, the touched accounts are only deleted at the end of the transaction (as opposed to immediately?)

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm *guessing* the thing mentioned in the rationale, but I'm not sure.

author: samwilsn
content: For anyone not on the call today (which is most of you), we think it's important to test because before spurious dragon, you could return nothing from initcode but still set storage keys.
